ygData.subject: The Stun idea and Bards in dungeons
ygData.msgSnippet: Yes, it is an area effect. This means you can only use it to stun in a safe battle, where you have one or two monsters and no real chance of strracting
ygData.messageBody:
Yes, it is an area effect. This means you can only use it to "stun" in a
safe battle, where you have one or two monsters and no real chance of
strracting others. Which brings up an interesting point.

I do way better in outdoor zones, because in a dungeon not only can I not
run, but I am afraid to use my really cool area effect songs (The Level 15
Lullaby, The Level 20 Weakening Song, to name a few).

Has anyone used these kind of songs in a dungeon, and if so what was the
result? Killing your group? I know it can only effect 4 creatures . . .
this can be an advantage, right? At most you piss off three things other
than the one you're attacking, right?

Comments?

-Musil Tearsong

>>>On-topic comment for those paying attention: What about suggesting a song
>>>that causes a stun - nothing else, just a stun. Kind of a "Bash" for
>>>Bards. Comments?
>
>At 12:17 PM 5/28/99 -0700, Musil Tearsong wrote:
>>The Level 15 Song (Lullaby) works just like a stun when used in mele
>>combat. It doesn't start working wel until well after Level 15, but once it
>>starts working, it is very nice.
>
>Ahh - this I did not know. But correct me if I am wrong, but isn't that an
>area-effect? I was thinking of a single-target. Something to throw in
>lower (maybe to replace the level 11 or something).
